text: Answer: (a, b, c) Solution: Process control information is used by the OS to manage the process itself. This includes: . Process scheduling state . Process structuring information . Inter-process communication information . Process Privileges . Process State . Process Number (PID) (also known as Process ID) . Program Counter (PC) . CPU Registers . CPU Scheduling Information . Memory Management Information . Accounting Information. . 1/0 Status Information It does not store thread status. Thread status will be store in Thread Control Block (TCB).
